clean_story: Bright screens. Vivid colors. The term 'OLED' stands for Organic Light Emitting Diode. In 2007, the first OLED TV was released, making screens thinner and more colorful. OLEDs light up each pixel individually, like turning on tiny flashlights instead of lighting a whole room. Example: Smartphones use OLEDs for sharper images and better battery life. Related subjects: display technology, energy efficiency, consumer electronics.
